p: In Malaysia, sepsis is a major cause of morbidity and mortality, particularly among ICU patients. In 2016 and 2017, sepsis was the most common diagnosis leading to ICU admission. Furthermore, in-hospital mortality rate following ICU admission due to sepsis also recorded an astonishing figureâ€”more than 50% for six consecutive years since 2012 [ 12]. An eight-year review of blood culture from sepsis cases in the Emergency Department in a Malaysia hospital revealed that 55.2% of the isolated organisms were Gram-negative bacteria. The bacteria were also found to be more resistant to antibiotics commonly prescribed in the outpatient setting [ 13]. These findings highlight an urgent need to reduce the burden caused by sepsis both in Malaysia and worldwide.
